org.wtc.eclipse.platform.helpers
Interface IJavaHelper

public interface IJavaHelper

Helper for java-specific actions.

Method Detail

addClassFolder

void addClassFolder(IUIContext ui,
                    IPath classFolder)
addClassFolder - Using the given full path, create the folder in the project if it does not already exist, then add that folder to the project's list of class folders.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePath - - The full path (project name included) of the class folder to (create and) add. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/classes

addExternalJARToClasspathViaAPI

void addExternalJARToClasspathViaAPI(IUIContext ui,
                                     java.lang.String javaProjectName,
                                     IPath jarPath,
                                     boolean isExported)
addExternalJARToClasspathViaAPI - Create a classpath entry for the given JAR path and add it to the given project's classpath. This is meant to be used for external jars, that do not live under the workspace root. For this to be safe on cruise control runs, this should be limited to paths from known temp directories, i.e. project metadata, etc.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
javaProjectName - - The name of the project to add the jar to
jarPath - - The absolute file system location path of the jar to be added to the project's classpath
isExported - - True if the JAR is to be added to the exported classpath list

addProjectFolderToClasspathViaAPI

void addProjectFolderToClasspathViaAPI(IUIContext ui,
                                       IPath folderPath)
addProjectFolderToClasspathViaAPI - Create a classpath entry for the given folder path and add it to the given project's classpath.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
folderPath - - The full path (project name included) to be added to it's parent project's classpath

addProjectJARToClasspath

void addProjectJARToClasspath(IUIContext ui,
                              IPath jarPath)
addProjectJARToClasspath - Use the project properties dialog to add the JAR at the given location to a project's build path. The specified JAR should already exist in the target project's resources (a project- to-project build dependency should use addProjectBuildDependency)

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
jarPath - - Full path (project included) of the JAR to add to the containing project's build path

addProjectJARToClasspathViaAPI

void addProjectJARToClasspathViaAPI(IUIContext ui,
                                    IPath jarPath,
                                    boolean isExported)
addProjectJARToClasspathViaAPI - Create a classpath entry for the given JAR path and add it to the given project's classpath.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
jarPath - - The full path (project name included) to be added to it's parent project's classpath
isExported - - True if the JAR is to be added to the exported classpath list

addSourceFolder

void addSourceFolder(IUIContext ui,
                     IPath sourceFolder)
                     throws SourceFolderCreationError
addSourceFolder - Using the given full path, create the folder in the project if it does not already exist, then add that folder to the project's list of source folders.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePath - - The full path (project name included) of the source folder to (create and) add. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/yourFolder
Throws:
SourceFolderCreationError - - When the given project is not a Java project, the given folder is already nested in another source folder, or the source folder could not be specified for any other reason

createClass

IPath createClass(IUIContext ui,
                  IPath outputPath,
                  java.lang.String packageName,
                  java.lang.String className)
createClass - Create a java class in the given source path, with the given package and class name.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
outputPath - - Full path (project included) of the source root to contain the package. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/yourFolder
packageName - - The dot-separated name of the package to create
className - - The name of the class to create
Returns:
IPath the full path project included of the newly created file

createClass

IPath createClass(IUIContext ui,
                  IPath outputPath,
                  java.lang.String packageName,
                  java.lang.String className,
                  java.lang.String superTypeClassName)
createClass - Create a java class in the given source path, with the given package and class name. Make this new class extend the given class

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
outputPath - - Full path (project included) of the source root to contain the package. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/yourFolder
packageName - - The dot-separated name of the package to create
className - - The name of the class to create
superTypeClassName - - The fully qualified class name of the class that this class should extend
Returns:
IPath the full path project included of the newly created file

createPackage

void createPackage(IUIContext ui,
                   IPath outputPath,
                   java.lang.String packageName)
createPackage - Create a java package in the given source path, with the given package name.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
outputPath - - Full path (project included) of the source root to contain the package. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/yourFolder
packageName - - The dot-separated name of the package to create

exportProjectJAROnClasspath

void exportProjectJAROnClasspath(IUIContext ui,
                                 IPath jarPath)
exportProjectJAROnClasspath - Add the JAR at the given path to the parent project's list of exported classpath entries. The JAR file must exist and must already be on the classpath.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
jarPath - - Full path (project included) of the JAR to export

getJavaType

IType getJavaType(java.lang.String projectName,
                  java.lang.String fullyQualifiedName)
getJavaType - Retrieves the IType for the specified Java type. Issues a TestCase failure if the specified type does not exist.

Parameters:
projectName - Name of project that should contain the Java type. Cannot be null and must be accessible.
fullyQualifiedName - Fully qualified name of the type. Cannot be null.
Returns:
IType representing the discovered Java type.

getPackageName

java.lang.String getPackageName(IUIContext ui,
                                IPath folderPath)
Get the Java package name for a container.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI-generated input
folderPath - - The full path (project included) to a path of a folder in the workspace
Returns:
String - The corresponding Java package name, or null if the container is not a package

removeAllSourceFolders

void removeAllSourceFolders(IUIContext ui,
                            java.lang.String projectName)
removeAllSourceFolders - Use the API to remove all source folders from the project with the given name.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
projectName - - Name of the project whose source folders are to be removed

renameClass

IPath renameClass(IUIContext ui,
                  IPath sourceFilePath,
                  java.lang.String newClassName)
renameClass - Rename a java class through a refactor operation.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourceFilePath - - The full path to the java source file containing the class to rename
newClassName - - The new name of the class
Returns:
The full path to the new file

verifyJavaType

void verifyJavaType(java.lang.String projectName,
                    java.lang.String fullyQualifiedName)
verifyJavaType - Uses an API call to check for the existence of the specified Java type. Issues a TestCase failure if the specified type does not exist.

IMPORTANT: Callers must ensure that the build has completed prior to making this call.

Parameters:
projectName - Name of project that should contain the Java type. Cannot be null and must be accessible.
fullyQualifiedName - Fully qualified name of the type. Cannot be null.

verifyJavaType

void verifyJavaType(java.lang.String projectName,
                    java.lang.String fullyQualifiedName,
                    boolean exists)
checkForJavaType - Uses an API call to check for the existence of the specified Java type. Issues a TestCase failure if the specified type either exists or does not exist, as determined by the "exists" parameter.

IMPORTANT: Callers must ensure that the build has completed prior to making this call.

Parameters:
projectName - Name of project that should contain the Java type. Cannot be null and must be accessible.
fullyQualifiedName - Fully qualified name of the type. Cannot be null.
exists - True if the type should exist, false if it should not exist.
